doc.field: Robert Matz Collection of New York University Postcards
Robert Matz Collection of New York University Postcards

Dr. Robert Matz is an alumnus of New York University. The Robert Matz Collection of New York University Postcards consists of postcards collected by Dr. Robert Matz documenting the University Heights and Washington Square campuses. Most of the postcards date from the early 1900s. The Gould Memorial Library, the Hall of Fame of Great Americans, and the Loeb Student Student are depicted in many of the postcards, alongside other NYU buildings and programs. The majority of the postcards are blank, but some contain handwritten messages.

The Robert Matz Collection of New York University Postcards consists of postcards collected by Dr. Robert Matz documenting the University Heights and Washington Square campuses. Most of the postcards date from the early 1900s. The Gould Memorial Library, the Hall of Fame of Great Americans, and the Loeb Student Student are depicted in many of the postcards, alongside other NYU buildings and programs. The majority of the postcards are blank, but some contain handwritten messages.
Dr. Robert Matz is an alumnus of New York University.
Donated by Robert Matz in January 2024; the accession number associated with this gift is 2024.016.

Robert Matz collected and purchased the postcards from multiple sources. The collection was physically transferred from Dr. Matz to Elizabeth Pimentel prior to acquisition. Some of the postcards originally in Matz's possession were sold or given to Pimentel prior to acquisition by the New York University Archives.
